application_type_full: Outline planning permission: Some matters reserved
description: Construction of 172 one, two and three bedroom apartments, together with access, parking (150 spaces) and landscaping (phase 11); (Outline application for approval of access, siting, design, and external appearance)
decision_conditions: Approval of details of the landscaping, including surfacing (called the "reserved matters") shall be obtained from the Local Planning Authority in writing before any development is commenced.  REASON: The application is in outline form only and approval for landscaping has not been sought, as required by policies 4.1 and 5.5 of the adopted Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment'. | Plans and particulars of the reserved matters for the development referred to in condition 1 above, relating to the landscaping of the site, shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority and approved in writing before the development is commenced and shall be carried out as approved.  Reason: To ensure that no part of the development commences until reserved matters are approved. This condition reflects the provisions Of Section 92 of the Town and Country Planning Act and Article 4 of the Town and Country (General Development Procedure) Order 1995. | Application for the approval of all the reserved matters shall be made to the Local Planning Authority before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.  Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended). | The development shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission or before the expiration of two years from the date of approval of the reserved matters to be approved, whichever is the later.  Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended). | Samples of the materials to be used for the external surfaces of the development shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before any part of the development is commenced, and this condition shall apply notwithstanding any indications as to these matters which have been given in this application.  Development shall be carried out in accordance with these approved details.  REASON: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policy 4.1 of the adopted Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment'. | No development shall take place until there has been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority a plan indicating the positions, design, materials and type of boundary treatment to be erected, and shall include details of any fencing to erected along side the canal.  Development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details and shall be completed before the residential units are first occupied and shall be permanently retained thereafter.  REASON: To protect the visual appearance of the area and the living conditions of neighbouring and prospective occupiers, in accordance with policies 4.1 and 5.5 of the adopted Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' and Supplementary Planning Guidance 8. | The car parking spaces shown on approved plan AplPh1103-001 Rev P4 shall be marked out on the site prior to first occupation of any part of the development, and these spaces shall be kept continuously available for car parking and shall not be used for any other purpose. 	 REASON: To ensure that there is adequate provision for car parking within the site, in accordance with policy 9.1 of the adopted Unitary Development Plan  'Plan for the Environment'. | Areas shown on the approved plans as parking, access, loading, unloading and manoeuvring areas shall be kept clear and unobstructed at all times and used for these purposes only.  REASON: To ensure that adequate parking and servicing space is available within the site, in accordance with policy 9.1 of the adopted Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment'. | Notwithstanding the details shown on the approved plan AplPh1103-001 Rev P4, prior to the commencement of any part of the development, details of pedestrian, cycle and vehicular access within the site shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  Such details shall include the widening of the access points to the undercroft parking area to ensure a minimum entrance width of 5.5m is achieved, and the details as approved shall be constructed before first occupation of any part of the development and shall be permanently retained thereafter.  REASON: To ensure the provision of suitable vehicle, pedestrian and cycle access arrangements in and around the site, in accordance with policy 9.1 of the adopted Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment'. | The cycle parking areas shown on the approved plan AplPh1103-001 Rev P4 shall be fully constructed prior to first occupation of any part of the development, and this area shall be kept continuously available for cycle parking and shall not be used for any other purpose. 	 REASON: To ensure that there is adequate provision for cycle parking within the site, in accordance with policy 9.1 of the adopted Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment'. | The refuse (and recycling) storage area shown on the approved plan AplPh1103-001 Rev P4 shall be fully constructed prior to first occupation of any part of the development, and this area shall be kept continuously available for refuse and recycling storage and shall not be used for any other purpose. 	 REASON: To ensure that there is adequate provision for refuse and recycling storage within the site, in accordance with policies 2.10 and 4.1 of the adopted Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment'. | All residential units shall be constructed as approved and retained as such permanently thereafter, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.   REASON: To ensure compliance with Affordable Housing, Lifetime Homes and Wheelchair Housing standards, in accordance with policies 5.2 and 5.3 of the adopted Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment', Supplementary Planning Guidance 7 and Supplementary Planning Document 1. | No dwelling within the development hereby approved shall be occupied until the highway improvement works at the Broadmead Road/Ruislip Road junction as set out in the legal agreement dated 30 April 2004 under s278 Highways Act 1980 (or as may subsequently be varied or substituted by a new agreement) have been completed to the Council's satisfaction as local highway authority.  REASON: To ensure that the required highway improvement works are implemented, in accordance with policies 9.1 and 9.9 of the adopted Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment'. | No development shall take place until details have been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority outlining how the existing habitats within the canal would be maintained and enhanced, and these details shall include the specific design of the viewing platform, which must be designed in a manner that does not interfere with existing wildlife corridors.  Development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details, which shall be completed before the residential units are first occupied and shall be permanently retained thereafter.  REASON :  To ensure that the ecology of the canal is maintained and enhanced, in accordance with policies 43.2, 3.8 and 4.5 of the adopted Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment'. | No development shall commence until details of a site construction method statement/management plan has been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  The method statement/management plan shall include the following:  -on-site construction worker parking -anticipated number, frequency and size of construction vehicles entering/exiting the site -delivery times (staggered to avoid morning and afternoon school run peak periods) -dust suppression measures -wheel washing provisions -site security -vehicle manoeuvring and turning, including sweep path diagrams to demonstrate how vehicles will access the site and be able to turn into and emerge from the site in forward gear. -the location of materials storage, site cabins, cranes, building machinery etc on a site plan. -procedures for on-site contractors to deal with complaints from local residents  Such details shall be implemented, or phasing agreed in writing, prior to the commencement of works on site and thereafter retained for the duration of the works.  REASON :  To ensure appropriate mitigation measures are put in place to protect the landscaped character of the site and the amenity of local residents and to ensure adequate highway and site safety, in accordance with adopted UDP policies 4.5, 4.11, 9.1 and 9.9. | Details of all external lighting, which shall pay due regard to low energy and other sustainable forms of lighting, demonstrating compliance with the recommendations of the Institution of Lighting Engineers "Guidance Notes for the Reduction of Light Pollution" and the provisions of BS 5489 Part 9, shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to the commencement of the development.  The submitted details shall include vertical illumination levels and provisions for reducing glare and the lighting shall thereafter be provided and maintained solely in accordance with the approved details.    REASON:  To prevent light spillage in the interests of the ecology of the canal and the living conditions of local residents, in accordance with policies 4.12 and 5.5 of the adopted Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment'. | A scheme for protecting sensitive rooms/ balconies/gardens from external noise, to the following criteria, shall be submitted to and shall be approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to the commencement of the development, and such details shall be implemented as approved, prior to the first occupation of the development and permanently retained thereafter.  The scheme shall also include details on the provision of alternative ventilation to meet the situation when windows have to remain closed for insulation against noise.   The following noise criteria shall be met:   Noise levels at the following locations shall not exceed -   Private gardens and balconies - not greater than 50dB(A)Leq, 1 hour (07:00 - 23:00 hrs.)  Bedrooms - not greater than 30 dB(A)Leq, 1 hour (23:00 - 07:00 hrs.); 45 dB LAmax,1hr (2300 -0700 hrs)  Living rooms and dining rooms - not greater than 35 dB(A)Leq, 1 hour (07:00 - 23:00 hrs.)   Kitchens, bathrooms and utility rooms - not greater than 45 dB(A)Leq, 1 hour (07:00 - 23:00 hrs.).  REASON:  In the interest of the living conditions of prospective occupants, in accordance with policies 4.11 and 5.5 of the adopted Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' and Supplementary Planning Guidance 10. | Details of the design and construction of the development hereby approved demonstrating compliance with the EcoHomes 'very good' standards, shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to commencement of the development and the details as approved shall be implemented prior to occupation of any of the dwellings hereby approved and permanently retained thereafter.'  REASON: To ensure that a sustainable form of development is achieved, in accordance with policies 2.1 and 2.9 of the adopted Unitary Development Plan 'New Plan for the Environment. | Prior to commencement of development, details of the design of the building and its associated facilities demonstrating compliance with the requirements of Secure By Design shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The works shall be carried out as approved prior to the occupation of any part of the development and shall be permanently retained.  Reason: In the interest of the safety of adjoining occupiers and prospective occupiers of the development, in accordance policy 4.4 of the adopted Unitary Development Plan and Supplementary Planning Guidance 8. | The use of the City Car Club scheme secured in the legal agreement dated 3 May 2002 attached to outline approval referenced P/2000/2986 shall be made available to occupiers of the development prior to first occupation, and this shall remain for the lifetime of the City Car Club's operation.  REASON: To ensure that the City Car Club scheme is available to occupiers of the development, in accordance with policy 9.8 of the adopted Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment. | The measures within the Green Travel Plan secured in the legal agreement dated 3 May 2002 attached to outline approval referenced P/2000/2986 shall be made known to occupiers of the development prior to first occupation.  REASON: To promote the use of sustainable forms of transportation, in accordance with policy 9.1 of the adopted Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment and Supplementary Planning Guidance 21. | The land remediation measures approved as part of planning approval referenced P/2002/1673 shall be undertaken with respect to the application site and these measures shall be implemented prior to the commencement of development of any part of the site and shall be permanently retained thereafter.  REASON: To ensure that contaminants are removed from site to ensure that a suitable living environment is provided for prospective occupants, in accordance with policy 2.7 of the adopted Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment.
